name: The Captain's Boil
description: Buzzy, maritime-themed destination specializing in boil-in-a-bag Cajun- & Asian-inspired seafood.
address: The Captain's Boil, 3309 Kingsway, Vancouver, BC V5R 5K6

featured_reviews.review_id:
Brian is the MAN!!!!!
The service is out of this world!
Super friendly and knows the menu inside and out.
This was our first time here so we didn't know what to order, Brian spend his time with us and was very patient.
Was he ever was right about the suggestions, the best seafood I ever had, did I mention they would come by and take the empties right away and refill everything right away.
Had a blast of the night, will be back super soon.
10 stars, thank you Brian.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We are delighted to know that you had a great experience with us. Look forward to your future visit!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Woahhh, holy shrimp what a feast!
We hauled a couple of 1lb Cajun Shrimp with Broccoli which could have realistically fed four people, great value for money considering the competition to be fair.
In terms of the flavor, super yummy blend of Cajun and on point in terms of spices. The heat (extra hot) wasn't as spicy as I hoped and I think was masked due to the overwhelming greasy, buttery garlic aftertaste which for me was way too overpowering and unfortunately ruined it, so much that I felt nausea for a while after and couldn't stomach another bite all day.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for leaving us a review. We appreciate your feedback and will address it with the team to ensure a better experience in the future. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the future.

featured_reviews.review_id: We went around 5:45pm. Place was not busy. The staff was attentive, we're seated quickly. It was our 1st time there so we were nervous and having trouble following the menu. We got a staff explaining it us. He patiently did so. Our orders came quickly and piping hot. Price was reasonable. But the only unpleasant thing was 2 of us (out of 4) experienced slight food poisoning after that meal. We all ate the same meal and did not have anything else before or after our visit to this restaurant. May 2 of us managed to eat 1 or 2 shellfishes that had gone bad.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for your five-star review. We are delighted to know that you had a positive experience with us. Look forward to your future visit!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We went here for the first time today and I felt so disappointed. I think it will also be my last time coming here because I was actually not satisfied with the food. First of all it was so salty. I don't know what you did to my king crab legs sea food boil but the sauce was extremely salty to the point where I had to order a different food which was the clams and mussels just to compare if the sauce was really supposed to be like that. When I tasted the cajun sauce of the mussel and clam it was surprisingly fine (better than the cajun sauce of the king crab). I was wondering why this happened but I didn't bother being a Karen because there were too many people and I felt ashamed to even ask seeing how busy it was today. Please look into your salt pouring/measuring because imagine going to sea and drinking the salty water, that is what the sauce tasted like.
For having to pay $150 I must say it is not worth it. Great trial and error though. Try at your own risk.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We apologize for any disappointment you experienced with our food during your recent visit. We appreciate your feedback and will address it with the team to ensure a better experience in the future. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

featured_reviews.review_id: The food was fantastic. Headless shrimp, fried rice, calamari corn on the cob was all great. And of course lobster was fantastic. Service is a bit slow. But they are very busy. They are friendly. I would recommend calling to reserve a table. Or wait at least 45 minutes
featured_reviews.review_text: The food was fantastic. Headless shrimp, fried rice, calamari corn on the cob was all great. And of course lobster was fantastic. Service is a bit slow. But they are very busy. They are friendly. I would recommend calling to reserve a table. Or wait at least 45 minutes
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We are delighted to know that you had a great experience with us. Look forward to your future visit!

featured_reviews.review_id: I have eaten here before and it was nice, however this time around I ordered for pick up and the staff was very nice from phone call till I picked up the order. The food was good, lobster sandwiches was a bit dry but still very good service.
featured_reviews.review_text: I have eaten here before and it was nice, however this time around I ordered for pick up and the staff was very nice from phone call till I picked up the order. The food was good, lobster sandwiches was a bit dry but still very good service.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us. We are delighted to know that you had a positive experience with us. Look forward to your future visit!

featured_reviews.review_id: Celebrated a birthday and wanted a whole lobster. So we ordered the Pirate's Feast. Oh boy, what a feast! The Captain's Boil sauce is soooo finger-licking good (a tad too salty but still yummy nonetheless) and all the seafood we selected were fresh and cooked just nice. Besides the corn being too soggy to our liking, everything else was on point. Obviously the two of us could only manage half of the feast and had to pack the rest home. It's our first time here and we were guided by the nice servers how to order. Will be back for sure.
featured_reviews.review_text: Celebrated a birthday and wanted a whole lobster. So we ordered the Pirate's Feast. Oh boy, what a feast! featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience at The Captain's Boil. We are so pleased to hear you found your experience your liking. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Second visit to a Captain Boil, 1st visit in Richmond 2nd visit Kingsway & Joyce in Vancouver.
Staff accommodated a reservation for 14 while having a group of 30 booked an hour later, much appreciated.
Food was delicious and no complains aside from one of the two claws being smaller than a pinky finger.  When pointed out to management no fix was offered and we paid per crab not by weight.
Aside from that hiccup the service was good, food tasted great and reasonable time to bring out the food.
